intro: Herrania nycterodendron, commonly known as the nightshade tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 3–5 meters. The plant features simple, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in panicles, blooming in the evening. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
